tasks.title: Set up project workspace and documentation structure
tasks.description: Create standardized folder structure and templates for transfer packets, master settlement PRD, traceability tables, and canonical reports following current best practices.
tasks.details: Use Markdown files with standardized templates inspired by Atlassian and monday.com PRD structures (2024 standards)[4][3]. Create directories: `/transfer-packets/`, `/master-prd/`, `/traceability/`, `/acceptance-matrices/`, `/reports/`. Implement template with sections: purpose, objectives, functional/non-functional reqs, test hooks, acceptance criteria using YAML frontmatter for metadata. Use VS Code with Markdownlint (v0.47.0) and Prettier (v3.3.3) for consistency. Git init repo with .gitignore for docs only.
tasks.testStrategy: Validate folder structure exists at required paths, templates render correctly in Markdown previewers, no linting errors, git commit passes.

tasks.title: Synthesize source topics and manage contradictions
tasks.description: Analyze strategic concept corpus, synthesize key topics, identify and resolve contradictions to create clean input for transfer artifacts.
tasks.details: Use Notion AI (2026) or Obsidian with Dataview plugin (v0.5.66) for topic synthesis. Create contradiction log table: columns [Topic, Source, Contradiction, Resolution, Provenance]. Apply PMI PRD methodology: map to business needs first[2]. Output JSON/YAML summary: `{topics: [{id, summary, sources[], contradictions:[]}]}`. Ensure provenance as `source: {url, date, excerpt}`.
tasks.testStrategy: Review synthesis covers all sources, contradictions logged and resolved, JSON validates against schema, no unresolved conflicts.

tasks.title: Refine master settlement PRD with module-level requirements
tasks.description: Develop implementation-oriented master PRD with precise module hooks based on synthesized topics.
tasks.details:
Follow Jama Software structure: Purpose, Features (module hooks), User Tasks, Acceptance Criteria[1]. Define modules explicitly (infer from context: settlement-core, integration-lanes, packet-governance). Use MoSCoW prioritization (2024 best practice)[5]. Template: `## Module: [name]
### Hooks: [API/endpoint specs]
### Req: [detailed, traceable]` with explicit traceability links `-> topic-[id]`. Output Markdown at `/master-prd/settlement-mprd.md`.
tasks.testStrategy: PRD contains all modules with hooks, traceable to topics, passes checklist: purpose/features/reqs/acceptance present.

tasks.title: Define test hooks for each critical module area
tasks.description: Create specific, actionable test hooks mapped to each module for integration lanes.
tasks.details: For each module from task 19, define hooks as: `Test Hook [module]-[id]: {endpoint, method, expected_response, pass_criteria}`. Use table format: | Module | Hook ID | Type | Spec |. Types: unit/integration/e2e. Follow FRD best practices for designer-ready specs[2]. Store as `/test-hooks/module-hooks.yaml`. Example: `integration_lane_ping: {path: '/health/settlement', status: 200}`.
tasks.testStrategy: Every module has ≥1 hook, specs executable (curl-able), coverage 100% of critical areas.

tasks.title: Build acceptance matrix mapping modules to pass/fail evidence
tasks.description: Develop comprehensive matrix linking modules, test hooks, and pass/fail criteria.
tasks.details: Create Markdown table or CSV: | Module | Test Hook | Pass Criteria | Fail Evidence | Traceability |. Use Productboard clarity standards[6]. Pass criteria: quantitative (e.g., response<500ms) + qualitative. Export to `/acceptance-matrices/settlement-matrix.md/csv`. Ensure auditable: each cell links to PRD section and topic ID.
tasks.testStrategy: Matrix complete (no empty cells), all links resolve, covers 100% modules/hooks, stakeholders confirm readability.

tasks.title: Implement explicit traceability tables from source to requirements
tasks.description: Create auditable traceability artifacts mapping source topics → modules → test hooks → acceptance.
tasks.details: Build bi-directional traceability matrix using Excel/Google Sheets or Mermaid diagrams (v10.9.1): `graph TD; Topic1 --> ModuleA --> Hook1 --> Criteria1`. JSON format: `{trace: [{source_id, module_id, hook_id, criteria_id}]}` at `/traceability/full-trace.json`. Comply with PMI standards[2], validate no orphans.
tasks.testStrategy: Traceability 100% (every req traces to source and test), graph renders correctly, JSON schema valid.

tasks.title: Package transfer artifacts into module-level transfer packets
tasks.description: Assemble consumable transfer packets bundling PRD sections, hooks, matrices for each module.
tasks.details: For each module, create ZIP/tar packet: `[module]/prd.md, hooks.yaml, matrix.csv, trace.json`. Naming: `transfer-packet-[module]-v1.0.tar.gz`. Follow work packet assembly from PMI[2]. Ensure no interpretation needed: self-contained with README.md linking all components.
tasks.testStrategy: Packets exist at `/transfer-packets/`, extract cleanly, contain all 4 artifacts, README accurate.

tasks.title: Generate canonical reports for each transfer packet
tasks.description: Emit standardized reports summarizing each packet with evidence requirements.
tasks.details: Use Pandoc (v3.5) or Python ReportLab (v4.2.2) to generate PDF/HTML: sections - Summary, Traceability, Test Hooks, Acceptance Matrix. Include paths: `Packet: /transfer-packets/[module]`. Metrics: coverage %, risks. Output to `/reports/packet-[module]-report.pdf`. Template from modern PRD guide[7].
tasks.testStrategy: Reports generate without errors, contain all sections, paths resolve, PDF opens correctly.

tasks.title: Implement shared memory completion ping mechanism
tasks.description: Set up simple signaling mechanism to indicate completion for canonical lanes.
tasks.details: Use file-based ping: `/shared-memory/settlement-lab-complete.json` with `{status: 'complete', timestamp, packet_count, sha256_hash}`. Or Redis (v7.4) pub/sub if infra available: `PUBLISH settlement:complete {...}`. Atomic write with fsync. Best practice: simple file for doc-only scope.
tasks.testStrategy: Ping file created post-task24, content valid JSON, hash matches packets, readable by other processes.

tasks.title: Conduct final validation and rolling update setup
tasks.description: Validate all artifacts against acceptance criteria and establish rolling packet update process.
tasks.details: Checklist script (bash/Python): verify paths, traceability, coverage. Version packets with semver, git tag releases. Mitigation for stale specs: CI/CD webhook trigger on main merge. Doc update process in `/process/rolling-updates.md`.
tasks.testStrategy: All acceptance criteria pass, checklist 100%, lanes confirm direct usability, no stale refs.
